components.name: Raspberry Pi Compute Module CM4
components.notes: Requires dt-blob.bin for dual camera support on air. Carrier board needs HDMI and USB for ground use.

components.name: Raspberry Pi Zero 2
components.notes: Most cost-effective option

components.name: Radxa Rock5B
components.notes: Significantly higher performance than Raspberry Pi. Early stage software development. HDMI pipeline support.

components.name: Radxa Rock5A
components.notes: Early stage software development

components.name: Raspberry Pi 3B
components.notes: Older model with USB2 only. Still functional for basic OpenHD setups.

components.name: Raspberry Pi 3B mini
components.notes: Compact version of the 3B.

components.name: Raspberry Pi 3A
components.notes: Single USB port, lower RAM. Basic functionality only.

components.name: Raspberry Pi 3A+
components.notes: Improved version of 3A with better performance.

components.name: Raspberry Pi Compute Module CM3+
components.notes: Compute module format. Requires carrier board for functionality.

components.name: Raspberry Pi 2B v1.2
components.notes: Older hardware with limited performance. Not recommended for new installations.

components.name: Radxa CM3
components.notes: Currently being worked on. May have limited camera compatibility.

components.name: Core3566
components.notes: Currently being worked on. May have limited camera compatibility.

components.name: Radxa Zero3W
components.notes: Currently being worked on. Compact form factor.

components.name: X86 Desktop/Laptop
components.notes: Performance varies greatly on hardware used. Requires Ubuntu 22.04. May interfere with normal WiFi setup.

components.name: OpenHD Custom Hardware
components.notes: Lowest possible latency with carefully selected components and optimizations. In development.

components.name: Arducam SkyMaster HDR (IMX708)
components.notes: Top recommended camera for OpenHD

components.name: Raspberry Pi Camera V1 (OV5647)
components.notes: Uses legacy raspivid. Not recommended for FPV due to poor outdoor performance. Sensor no longer produced.

components.name: FLIR Boson 320
components.notes: Requires special setup and drivers

components.name: Radxa IMX415
components.notes: May not meet OpenHD requirements. Initial pipeline included but may not work well.

components.name: Raspberry Pi Camera V2 (IMX219)
components.notes: MMAL overlay support. Good standard camera.

components.name: Raspberry Pi Camera HQ (IMX477)
components.notes: MMAL overlay support. High quality sensor with interchangeable lenses.

components.name: Arducam IMX477 Mini
components.notes: libcamera_imx477 support. Compact version of HQ camera.

components.name: Arducam IMX519 MINI
components.notes: libcamera_imx519 support. High quality mini camera with autofocus.

components.name: Arducam STARVIS IMX290
components.notes: libcamera_imx290 support. Excellent low-light performance.

components.name: Arducam STARVIS IMX327
components.notes: libcamera_imx327 support. Excellent low-light performance.

components.name: VEYE IMX 327E
components.notes: veye_cam2m overlay support. Professional low-light camera.

components.name: VEYE IMX307
components.notes: Professional low-light camera. Price varies by vendor.

components.name: Hti-201
components.notes: 320x240, 9hz, Raytheon sensor, Chalcogenide lens. USB thermal camera.

components.name: Hti-301
components.notes: 384x288, 25hz, iRay sensor, Germanium lens. USB thermal camera.

components.name: Infiray T2 search
components.notes: 256Ã—192, 25hz, iRay sensor, Germanium lens. USB thermal camera.

components.name: FLIR Boson 640
components.notes: 640x512, 9hz/60hz, FLIR sensor, Germanium lens. High-end thermal camera.

components.name: Geekworm C779
components.notes: 2 CSI lanes, up to 1080p@30fps. HDMI to CSI adapter.

components.name: Geekworm C790
components.notes: 4 CSI lanes, up to 1080p@30fps. HDMI to CSI adapter with better bandwidth.

components.name: IMX219 (for Radxa)
components.notes: Listed for Radxa but noted as having no compatible adapter currently.

components.name: Arducam IMX462 B0333 (for Radxa)
components.notes: Recommended for Radxa boards. Part number B0333.

components.name: Arducam IMX708 B0310 (for Radxa)
components.notes: Recommended for Radxa boards. Part number B0310.

components.name: ASUS USB-AC56
components.notes: Most popular choice. Small size, widely available. One internal antenna, second via RP-SMA. We recommend using this in 5.8GHz mode.

components.name: ALFA AWUS036ACH
components.notes: We recommend using this in 5.8GHz mode.

components.name: BLM8812EU
components.notes: Most recent and potent chip. Best cost/performance. No FCC/CE certification - use at own risk.

components.name: Taobao Card RTL8812AU
components.notes: Widely used, tends to get hot. Requires soldered wiring for reliable connection. We recommend using this in 5.8GHz mode.

components.name: TP-LINK T3U Plus
components.notes: We recommend using this in 5.8GHz mode.

components.name: Tenda U12
components.notes: 60mW, 2x MS156 2x internal antennas. Budget option.

components.name: Cudy AC 1300
components.notes: Low power <50mW, internal antennas only. Compact design.

components.name: Aigital AC1200
components.notes: Low power, internal antennas. Basic functionality.

components.name: COMFAST 1300Mbps
components.notes: Low power, internal antennas. Budget option.

components.name: D-Link DWA-182
components.notes: 70mW, 2x internal antennas. Good middle-ground option.

components.name: TP-Link T3U
components.notes: 80mW, 2x MS156 2x internal antennas. Non-Plus version.

components.name: Netgear A6100
components.notes: 50mW, 1x internal antenna. Without STBC/LDPC support. Limited performance.
